item.name: 221B Baker St.: Sherlock Holmes & the Time Machine
item.comment: A lesser version of the original 221: this one loses the shadowy Victorian ambience of the first for the sake of famous cases throughout history: who really shot JFK, etc.

item.name: 221B Baker Street: The Master Detective Game
item.comment: Well-written cases with that classic Victorian London feel. The only (minor) problem is the roll-and-move aspect that usually slows it down.

item.name: 7 Wonders
item.comment: Beautiful, fast, addictive and super fun.

item.name: 7th Sea Collectible Card Game
item.comment: With a name like 7th Sea, I HAD to give it a 7. And yeah, it's about a 7.

item.name: Agricola
item.comment:
I enjoy this Solo. My wife won't play: doesn't like the cutthroat nature. And the pressure of having to feed your people.
EDIT: Introduced this to my 8-year-old and she is loving it: YES!

item.name: All-Star Baseball
item.comment: This was my introduction into sports board games. Dad played this as a kid and introduced it to me when I was a kid... can't say how many times we played this one. Good times; great memories.

item.name: Android: Netrunner
item.comment: Wow. And truly assymetrical.

item.name: Ants in the Pants
item.comment: Classic dexterity game. It also gets to be boring.

item.name: Apples to Apples
item.comment: When it comes to party games, this is definitely my favorite.

item.name: At the Gates of Loyang
item.comment: Who knew that trading your vegetables could be this much fun??

item.name: Axis & Allies
item.comment: The One. The Only. Axis. And. Allies. But MAN. The set-up takes forever. And the gameplay too.

item.name: Bakong
item.comment:
Indiana Jones-type theme that plays in 20 minutes or so with two players and has an interesting dice mechanism where one of the dice rolled is for flipping a tile on the path and the other is for movement.
This one has helped Maya learn her die numbers. Was her favorite until Citadels came along...

item.name: Battle of the Sexes
item.comment: The game doesn't work so well with two players. We've only played with two players. This game doesn't work so well for us.

item.name: Battleship (second edition)
item.comment:
I played this again recently with my 5-year-old. She doesn't fully get it yet. As for me, not as fun as it used to be.
EDIT: She gets it now (now 7 years old). It is like MasterMind (which she loves), but much longer (which she does not like).

item.name: Betrayal at House on the Hill
item.comment: The fleshed-out, more story-driven version of one of my childhood favorites (Mystery Mansion). New villains each time, cool items, mega rooms, lots of atmosphere... very groovy.

item.name: Candy Land
item.comment: Ahh CandyLand, ohh me.

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment: Didn't get the appeal the first couple times. Now I do: enjoyable.

item.name: Castle Panic
item.comment: It's a fun, lighter Co-op that Maya, who is 7, enjoys.

item.name: The Castles of Burgundy
item.comment: More like The Castles of AWESOME!

item.name: Catan
item.comment: Good game. But at 10 VPs for the win, it gets too long for us. We play to 8.

item.name: Checkers
item.comment: Good way to introduce strategy to the girls.

item.name: Chess
item.comment: I still remember when I got my electronic chess set from RadioShack for Christmas. A defining moment. :)

item.name: Citadels
item.comment:
Very fun. Love playing this with my 6-year-old.
EDIT: Has lost its luster.

item.name: Clue
item.comment: As a kid, I Loved this game. And then I discovered 221...

item.name: Connect Four
item.comment: I still enjoy this every now and again.

item.name: Cranium
item.comment: I'm not a good artist or maker-of-things out of playdoh... so it's not my favorite.

item.name: Dominion
item.comment:
Love it. That is all.
EDIT(12/27/14): And now we have Intrigue with its Combo cards, very fun.

item.name: Don't Break the Ice
item.comment: Is the set-up time worth it..??

item.name: Don't Spill the Beans
item.comment: Whooops, they just spilled the FUN when they designed this game.

item.name: Elefun
item.comment:
Maya really gets into this: that alone makes it worth a play now and then.
EDIT: "We lost some of the nets and some of the butterflies," says Maya.

item.name: Fluxx
item.comment: This game is the Ultimate in wacky, unpredictable fun. You've never played a card game like this.

item.name: Forbidden Island
item.comment: Our introduction into a fully co-op game has beautiful artwork, is fun for Maya, and has good tension when set on the highest difficulty level.

item.name: Fun at the Zoo Game
item.comment: CandyLand at the Zoo with animals for tokens.

item.name: The Game of Life: The Simpsons Edition
item.comment: Ahhhh Life...

item.name: Ghost Stories
item.comment: Super challenging. And very fun. Just don't plan on winning all the time. Or even some of the time.

item.name: Hey, That's My Fish!
item.comment: Great game for getting your kids into strategic thinking. And it's fun too: always a bonus.

item.name: Hi Ho! Cherry-O
item.comment: Good way to get the kids started with their numbers.

item.name: Hungry Hungry Hippos Fun on the Run Game
item.comment: Loud.

item.name: Jaipur
item.comment: So pretty and easy to setup that we have to play it once in awhile. And Maya enjoys.

item.name: Jeopardy! Simpsons Edition
item.comment: Fun if you know your Simpsons Trivia; otherwise, not so much.

item.name: Let's Go Fishin'
item.comment: Good dexterity game for kids... and for adults who need work on their "it-takes-a-steady-hand!" skills.

item.name: The Logo Board Game
item.comment: Different take on trivia. The board is boring but the actual questions can be fun and challenging.

item.name: London
item.comment: Excellent. Love the theme, the history. And now playing a quick solo version.

item.name: Loot
item.comment: Maya says, "Fun and just a tiny bit challenging, and my daddy likes to play this game with me, and my head still hurts."

item.name: The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game
item.comment: Good CCG: enjoyed getting to play both dark and light side in same game (and from same hand, actually). Sometimes it could get unbalanced (aka: too easy for the good guys) if a player stacked their good side with characters only (or mostly) and no extras.

item.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
item.comment: Good game: enjoying the LCG design as opposed to the CCG where you could buy hundreds of packs and still not get the card(s) you wanted. But WOW tough game: especially when you play Solo with one deck like I do. Still, the challenge brings you back.

item.name: Love Letter
item.comment:
Maya likes everything about it, except for the Baron because "I always lose when the Baron comes up." - Maya
Daddy likes this as a good filler game because of its good artwork, simple rules and a fun deduction-style mechanism.

item.name: Macao
item.comment: Feld is Fenomenal. And the cubes are just so dang pretty.

item.name: Memory
item.comment: More fun than I remember...

item.name: Monopoly
item.comment: Ok, with the addition of the new Speed Die, they have indeed sped it up... what the Playmaster did in a better, albeit electronic 80's, way.

item.name: Monopoly Deal Card Game
item.comment: Decent little card game with some cutthroat elements: and it is for that reason this doesn't get much play at our house... my wife's not one for the cutthroat stuff.

item.name: Monopoly: Star Wars Episode 1
item.comment: Looks great, with some stellar figures. Yeh, I said Stellar.

item.name: Monopoly: Star Wars Limited Collector's Edition
item.comment: Cool if you like the SW.

item.name: Mouse Trap
item.comment: oh how I've grown to despise this game!

item.name: My first Skip-Bo
item.comment: Maya asks for this one fairly often.

item.name: Mystery Rummy: Jack the Ripper
item.comment: Good rummy-style card game with some interesting side strategy and theme (albeit dark) to go with.

item.name: Mystery Rummy: Jekyll & Hyde
item.comment: See: Mystery Rummy-Jack the Ripper, and add a bit of a twist... To play Jekyll cards, the Jekyll/Hyde card must have Jekyll face up; to play Hyde, the Hyde side must be up. This can be changed throughout..

item.name: Name That Tune 80's Edition DVD Game
item.comment: The clues started repeating in the second game. Not good.

item.name: Nuts!
item.comment: Fun artwork for the kids with some inside humor for the adults. Fast, simple, silly fun.

item.name: Old Maid
item.comment: Yeh, Awesome way to tell kids that hanging around older people (or becoming one yourself) is the very worst thing that could happen to you!

item.name: Pandemic
item.comment: Great design, great tension, great co-op, great fun.

item.name: Perfection
item.comment: Maya loves the pop, though it did scare her at first: she got this for her 5th birthday.

item.name: Pictureka! Card Game
item.comment: Fun, silly art with four games for kids. Maya is enjoying.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy
item.comment: Eurooooo.... iiiiiin..... Spaaaaaaaace!

item.name: Rack-O
item.comment: I've enjoyed this one for many years. Easy to teach and fun to play.

item.name: Rage
item.comment: Just retried this and, yes, it's fun. Like Rook (and other trick-taking games) but you can play with 2. Have a feeling my mo-in-law would love this.

item.name: Risk
item.comment: Though this original version has grown tired with it's constant dice rolling and fewer strategic options, it is the classic that spawned so many. Credit for that right there. And heck, it was fun when I was teen.

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
item.comment: Great gameplay tied to excellent storytelling. Brutally (and hilariously) true to its theme and great fun.

item.name: Rook
item.comment: This was a family favorite. Great trump card game. Simple as that. If only we could play this 2-player without using dummy hands. So... thank you, Rage.

item.name: Scattergories
item.comment: Classic party game. Good word fun.

item.name: Scene It? Movie
item.comment: Excellent movie trivia game. Actually played this one in it's prototype stage way back when.

item.name: Sequence for Kids
item.comment: This is helping Maya put her letters with her words.

item.name: Slap Jack
item.comment: Why don't you just slap ME if I ever suggest playing this.

item.name: Snakes and Ladders
item.comment: I gotta say, I do still enjoy this a little bit, even though Maya can get pretty upset when she hits a chute. Hopefully, Bakong has put this, and a few other kiddy games, to rest.

item.name: Sorry!
item.comment: At least it teaches the kids to say I'm Sorry. Sort of.

item.name: Sorry! Sliders
item.comment: "Challenging, but still fun because you're with your family and my head hurts," said Maya.

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game
item.comment: Decent little coop/solo.

item.name: Spot it Jr.! Animals
item.comment: Maya: "It's a little bit hard because when you are about to name the animal someone says it before you, but I like it."

item.name: Star Wars Customizable Card Game
item.comment: If the amount of money I poured into this one is any indicator, I really must have loved this. Great design, good fun in the StarWars world, though with all the detail they tried to maintain, it got tough keeping up with the rules. But it reminds me of some great times spent with my brother. Here's to that!

item.name: Star Wars: The Card Game
item.comment: Very good game. Great theme. Love the relative ease of putting a deck together with the 6-card pod system. Brilliant. Now if only I had someone around to play it with...

item.name: Star Wars: Trading Card Game
item.comment: Exciting, quick-battle, dice-rolling, Star Wars.

item.name: Stratego: Star Wars
item.comment: Hey, it's Stratego. And it's Star Wars. So it's got that going for it. And Maya's got the basics down now.

item.name: The Struggle for Catan
item.comment: Simpler, more compact version of the monster hit. We enjoy it. If you like Catan, you'll probably dig this. And you can toss it into your suitcase without getting charged an extra fifty bucks. No wait, that's Agricola. You get the idea.

item.name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis!
item.comment:
I had the original 1982 version of this as a kid, loved it, had forgotten all about it until I came across pics here... took me back in a big way, reminiscing on my golden board game days.. a beautiful time
Just picked up the 2010 re-release. Good, good fun.

item.name: There's a Moose in the House
item.comment: Funny fun for kids. I mean, how can you say "There's a Moose in the House" and not grin at least a little?

item.name: Ticket to Ride
item.comment: "I like the colors of the trains, and it's still a little bit challenging, but what matters is that I'm with my family, and my head STILL hurts," says Maya.

item.name: Tokaido
item.comment: Simply. Beautiful. And now Maya loves it.

item.name: Trajan
item.comment: YES! Hard to pick a favorite Feld between Castles, Macao and this, but given time, this may just take top prize.

item.name: Trivial Pursuit: 90's Time Capsule Edition
item.comment: My 2nd favorite version of Trivial Pursuit.

item.name: Trivial Pursuit: DVD Pop Culture 2
item.comment: Very good trivia game. And there's a DVD. Rock on.

item.name: Trivial Pursuit: Star Wars Classic Trilogy Collector's Edition
item.comment: My favorite version of TP.

item.name: Trivial Pursuit: The Beatles Collector's Edition
item.comment: Sample Beatles question: How many actual hairs are on Paul McCartney's head right now at this very moment in time? Just kidding that question is not in the game. But if you want to have any chance at winning this game, you better know just about EVERYTHING there is to know about the FabFour.

item.name: Trouble
item.comment: Weaker version of Sorry. But it does play quicker than the aforementioned.

item.name: UNO
item.comment: Most non-gamers will play it. Gotta give it that much.

item.name: Village
item.comment: Love this theme, the components, the gameplay with dying meeples and many options. Good stuff. And now better with the Inn expansion.

item.name: Yahtzee
item.comment: Bring It, you wacky dice, you!

item.name: Yahtzee Jr.
item.comment: Ours is the 2009 ToyStory3 Edition.
